Antidepressants, including selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs), are the third most prescribed drug class in the United States. It is estimated that 10% of Americans use antidepressants, representing a greater than 400% increase in use since 1994. Additionally, long-term use is becoming more common; 60% of SSRI users have been on treatment for over 2 years, and 14% of users have been on treatment for more than 10 years.
